ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:0.5_0: The training rule on receiving clothes
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood contemptuously, as if wanting to throw it away. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.3.1_0: “‘I will receive almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.4_0: He should receive the almsfood respectfully;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood contemptuously, as if wanting to throw it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.9_0: The seventh training rule is finished.
